column4: ok, this is strange, my pc uses 2.6 GB of RAM, yet the memory used by all the processes only adds up to about 500 MB
ubuntu caches most frequent disk accesses into memory to speed things up
well, hmm, how can I see what that cache is?
run top, it'll tell you how much memory you're using
well, it tells me I'm using ~3184156k
it doesn't say anything about cache
use SHIFT+> to sort by different uses
see the %MEM column, use SHIFT+> SHIFT+< until list is sorted by %MEM
sorting doesn't help, if it's a process that's using up this much memory, it doesn
sort until first process in the list has the highest number in %MEM column
you can use htop, its interface is a little more friendly and the number are less confusing
yes, I did that, what next? :-) â€” it's 1% i.e. ~40M
see what it says in terms of memory usage
i dont know, if it doesnt show up when you sort by memory usage, i really have no idea
i have started epiphany and now it gets listed with 8 processes (different pids, the rest is identical)
